column4: Number of household in order of visitation
column6: Value of home, if owned, or monthly rental, if rented
column7: Does this household live on a farm? (Yes or No)
column15: Attended school or college any time since March 1, 1940?
column23: State (or Territory or foreign country) of 1935 residence
column24: On a farm in 1935? (Yes or No)
column26: Was this person AT WORK for pay or profit in private or nonemergency Govt work during the week of March 24-30? (Yes or No)
column27: If not, was he at work on, or assigned to, public EMERGENCY WORK (WPA, NYA, CCC, etc during week of March 24-30? (Yes or No)
column28: If neither at work nor assigned to public emergency work, was this person SEEKING WORK? (Yes or No)
column29: If not seeking work, did he HAVE A JOB, business, etc? (Yes or No)
column30: For persons answering "No" to questions 21, 22, 23, and 24: indicate whether engaged in home housework (H), in school (S), unable to work (U), or other (Ot)
column32: If at private or nonemergency Government work ("Yes" in Column 21), the number of hours worked during week of March 24-30, 1940
column33: If at private or nonemergency Government work ("Yes" in Column 22 or 23), the duration of unemployment up to March 30, 1940 -- in weeks
column38: Number of weeks worked in 1939 (equivalent full-time weeks)
column39: Income in 1939, amount of money wages or salary received
column40: Did this person receive income of $50 or more from sources other than money wages or salary? (Yes or No)
